Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Draft] PMUI Tab Consolidation Proposal" (#12778) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Unable to use wildcards in nuspec files section" (#12777) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

NuGet Version: 5.6.0.6591

### Worked before?

No

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

We recently updated our `.nuspec` files to use `Path.AltDirectorySeparatorChar` (i.e. `/`) in the `files` section (for the `src` and `exclude` attributes) and NuGet does not seem to handle wildcards properly.

With the following `nuspec` file, only `./nuget-content/logo.png` will be copied (and all files inside `folder1` will be ignored - without any warnings in the verbose logs):
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<package> 
  <metadata> 
    <id>MyPackage.Id</id>
    <title>MyPackage - Title</title>
    <version>1.0.0.0</version> 
    <authors>Author</authors>
    <description>My package description</description>
    <language>en-US</language>
    <license type="expression">Apache-2.0</license>
    <icon>images/logo.png</icon>
  </metadata> 
  <files>
    <file src="./nuget-content/logo.png" target="images/" />
    <file src="./folder1/*.dll" target="lib/" exclude="**/*.xml" />
  </files>
</package>
```

Here's the folder structure:
```
‚îÇ   test.nuspec
‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄfolder1
‚îÇ       Assembly1.dll
‚îÇ       Assembly1.pdb
‚îÇ       Assembly1.xml
‚îÇ       Assembly2.dll
‚îÇ       Assembly2.pdb
‚îÇ       Assembly2.xml
‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄnuget-content
        logo.png
```

NuGet handles the `/` separator just fine, it's the wildcard entries that are being ignored. 

### Verbose Logs

```shell
PS> NuGet.exe pack .\test.nuspec -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 5.6.0.6591

Attempting to build package from 'test.nuspec'.

Id: MyPackage.Id
Version: 1.0.0.0
Authors: Author
Description: My package description
Dependencies: None

Added file '[Content_Types].xml'.
Added file '_rels/.rels'.
Added file 'images/logo.png'.
Added file 'MyPackage.Id.nuspec'.
Added file 'package/services/metadata/core-properties/28eddc391fd3451f9a3101dd93d93c9c.psmdcp'.

---

For reference, here's the output (which includes the correct files) when using `\` instead:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<package> 
  <metadata> 
    <id>MyPackage.Id</id>
    <title>MyPackage - Title</title>
    <version>1.0.0.0</version> 
    <authors>Author</authors>
    <description>My package description</description>
    <language>en-US</language>
    <license type="expression">Apache-2.0</license>
    <icon>images\logo.png</icon>
  </metadata> 
  <files>
    <file src=".\nuget-content\logo.png" target="images\" />
    <file src=".\folder1\*.dll" target="lib\" exclude="**\*.xml" />
  </files>
</package>


```
PS> NuGet.exe pack .\test.nuspec -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 5.6.0.6591
Attempting to build package from 'test.nuspec'.

Id: MyPackage.Id
Version: 1.0.0.0
Authors: Author
Description: My package description
Dependencies: None

Added file '[Content_Types].xml'.
Added file '_rels/.rels'.
Added file 'images/logo.png'.
Added file 'lib/Assembly1.dll'.
Added file 'lib/Assembly2.dll'.
Added file 'MyPackage.Id.nuspec'.
Added file 'package/services/metadata/core-properties/ecd2e2c1f2814efcb6f3789cfa2fc0be.psmdcp'.
```
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "GatewaysOperationsExtensions.GetDatasourceUsersAsync Method  always returns DatasourceUserAccessRight.Read " (#12773) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet SDK

### Product Version

Microsoft.PowerBI.Api 4.15.0 

### Worked before?

i dont know

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

GatewaysOperationsExtensions.GetDatasourceUsersAsync Method  always returns DatasourceUserAccessRight.Read, no matter what access right is configured on UI. 

1. Configure "Owner" access right for Gateway Connection: 
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/assets/140498067/1bb75ad0-2e6f-4caf-a187-77b8512482c3)

2. Fetch users using GetDatasourceUsersAsync method
3. DatasourceUserAccessRight is returned as "Read"

**Expected:** 
DatasourceUserAccessRight.ReadOverrideEffectiveIdentity should be returned 


Similar problem I observed with writing method, it only add users with "Read" role, no matter of the input. 


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add nullable annotations to NuGet.Common" (#12775) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGet.Common is [a package on nuget.org](https://www.nuget.org/packages/NuGet.Common/), and is part of the [NuGet Client SDK](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/reference/nuget-client-sdk). We are adding null annotations, so projects using [nullable reference types](https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/csharp/nullable-references) will benefit from compiler null checking, leading to improved software reliability (fewer NullReferenceExceptions).

However, projects that use NuGet.Common's APIs, and have `nullable` enabled, may encounter compiler errors when upgrading to a version of the package with annotations.

The work to annotate the package is intended not to have binary (ABI) breaking changes, and we won;t be changing any method signatures. However, while annotating we might find bugs that need small changes in behaviour in order to fix any compiler errors preventing NuGet itself from building.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet Pack includes non-portable PDB content files in .snupkg" (#12774) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

I am not able to upload a generated snupkg to Nuget.org. During indexing it always reports this error "The uploaded symbols package contains one or more pdbs that are not portable."

The snupkg in question contains a .NET assembly with a portable PDB (file starts with "BSJB"), but also a C++ component and its pdb. I suspect the portability-validation fails for the C++ pdb (starting with `Microsoft C/C++ MSF 7.00`), but there is nothing I can do here, since as far as I know, the portable-pdb format is a concept for .NET assemblies only.

### Repro Steps

1. Create snupkg with valid pdb from .NET assembly, and PDB from generated by MSVC in contentFiles
2. Try uploading to nuget.org

### Expected Behavior

Do not validate C++ pdbs

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The deprecated or vulnerable version label does not display in the version box using the click on version or press "‚Üì" method when typing a deprecated or vulnerable package version in the ‚Äúversion‚Äù drop-down box" (#12772) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

NuGet Client Release-6.7.x\6.7.0.125

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Repro Steps:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 


1. Create a C# Console App (.Net core) project.‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 
2. Right-click the project in Solution Explorer and select "Manage NuGet Packages‚Ä¶" menu item to open PM UI.‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 
3. Go to "Browse" tab and click a package (for example ‚ÄúNuGet.Core‚Äù or "Newtonsoft.Json").‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 
4. Click the "Version" drop-down box in the right panel.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 
5. ‚ÄØType a version (for example ‚Äú2.14.0‚Äù for package ‚ÄúNuGet.Core‚Äù or "12.0.1" for package "Newtonsoft.Json") which already exists in the list. 
6. Click the down arrow button to open the version drop-down list and click 12.0.1 (Vulnerable) in drop-down box or press ‚Äú‚Üì‚Äù  

#### Expected:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 


The version will display ‚Äú(Deprecated)‚Äù or ‚Äú(Vulnerable)‚Äù label in version box.‚ÄØ 

#### Actual:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
 

The version doesn‚Äôt display the ‚Äú(Deprecated)‚Äù or ‚Äú(Vulnerable)‚Äù label as belowÔºö‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
![screenshot](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/assets/84695155/f0d69c19-f767-481c-a482-0f4b2a6d5cfb)

#### Note:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

1. The repro rate is 100%.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 
2. This is not a regression since it is a new feature change.‚ÄØ 


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Microsoft Security Advisory CVE 2023-29337 | NuGet Client Remote Code Execution Vulnerability" (#69) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody: # Microsoft Security Advisory CVE 2023-29337 | NuGet Client Remote Code Execution Vulnerability ## Executive summary Microsoft is releasing this security advisory to provide information about a vulnerability in .NET and NuGet on Linux. This advisory also provides guidance on what developers can do to update their applications to remove this vulnerability. A vulnerability exists in .NET 6.0, .NET 7.0 and NuGet(nuget.exe, NuGet.Protocol, NuGet.Common, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Commands, Microsoft.Build.NuGetSdkResolver, NuGet.PackageManagement) where a potential race condition that can lead to a symlink attack on Linux. Non-Linux platforms are not affected. ## Discussion Discussion for this issue can be found at https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/12653 ## Mitigation factors Microsoft has not identified any mitigating factors for this vulnerability. ## Affected software This issue only affects Linux systems. ### NuGet & NuGet Packages - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.Protocol, NuGet.Common, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Commands, Microsoft.Build.NuGetSdkResolver, NuGet.PackageManagement 6.6.0 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.Protocol, NuGet.Common, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Commands, Microsoft.Build.NuGetSdkResolver, NuGet.PackageManagement 6.5.0 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.Protocol, NuGet.Common, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Commands, Microsoft.Build.NuGetSdkResolver, NuGet.PackageManagement 6.4.1 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.Protocol, NuGet.Common, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Commands, Microsoft.Build.NuGetSdkResolver, NuGet.PackageManagement 6.3.2 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.Protocol, NuGet.Common, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Commands, Microsoft.Build.NuGetSdkResolver, NuGet.PackageManagement 6.2.3 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.Protocol, NuGet.Common, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Commands, Microsoft.Build.NuGetSdkResolver, NuGet.PackageManagement 6.0.4 version or earlier. [GitHub Advisory](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/security/advisories/GHSA-6qmf-mmc7-6c2p) ### .NET SDK(s) - Any .NET SDK 7.0.106 or earlier, or 7.0.303 or earlier - Any .NET SDK 6.0.117 or earlier, or 6.0.312 or earlier, or 6.0.409 or earlier. ### How do I know if I am affected? If you have a NuGet package or .NET SDK with a version listed in [affected software](#affected-software), you're exposed to the vulnerability. ### How do I fix the issue? To fix the issue, please install the latest version of .NET 6.0 or .NET 7.0 and NuGet (NuGet.exe, NuGet.Protocol, NuGet.Common, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Commands, NuGet.PackageManagement versions). If you have installed one or more .NET SDKs through Visual Studio, Visual Studio will prompt you to update Visual Studio, which will also update your .NET SDKs. - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.6.0 or lower, you should download and install 6.6.1 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.6.1/nuget.exe. - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.5.0 or lower, you should download and install 6.5.1 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.5.1/nuget.exe. - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.4.1 or lower, you should download and install 6.4.2 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.4.2/nuget.exe. - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.3.2 or lower, you should download and install 6.3.3 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.3.3/nuget.exe. - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.2.3 or lower, you should download and install 6.2.4 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.2.4/nuget.exe. - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.0.4 or lower, you should download and install 6.0.5 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.0.5/nuget.exe. You can get the version of NuGet.exe by running the‚ÄØ`nuget`‚ÄØcommand. You should see an output like the following: ``` NuGet Version: 6.0.0.280 usage: NuGet [args] [options] Type 'NuGet help ' for help on a specific command. To install additional .NET Core runtimes or SDKs: https://www.nuget.org/downloads ``` You can list the versions you have installed by running the‚ÄØ`dotnet --info`‚ÄØcommand. You should see an output like the following: ``` .NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json): Version: 6.0.300 Commit: 8473146e7d Runtime Environment: OS Name: Windows OS Version: 10.0.18363 OS Platform: Windows RID: win10-x64 Base Path: C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\6.0.300\ Host (useful for support): Version: 6.0.5 Commit: 8473146e7d .NET Core SDKs installed: 6.0.300 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk] .NET Core runtimes installed: Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 6.0.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App] Microsoft.NETCore.App 6.0.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App] Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 6.0.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App] To install additional .NET Core runtimes or SDKs: https://aka.ms/dotnet-download ``` - If you're using .NET 7.0, you should download and install Runtime 7.0.7 or SDK 7.0.107 or SDK 7.0.304 from https://dotnet.microsoft.com/download/dotnet-core/7.0. - If you're using .NET 6.0, you should download and install Runtime 6.0.18 or SDK 6.0.118 or SDK 6.0.312 from https://dotnet.microsoft.com/download/dotnet-core/6.0. Once you have installed the updated runtime or SDK, restart your apps for the update to take effect. Additionally, if you've deployed‚ÄØself-contained applications‚ÄØtargeting any of the impacted versions, these applications are also vulnerable and must be recompiled and redeployed. ## Other Information ### Reporting Security Issues If you have found a potential security issue in .NET 6.0 or .NET 7.0, please email details to secure@microsoft.com. Reports may qualify for the Microsoft .NET Core & .NET 5 Bounty. Details of the Microsoft .NET Bounty Program including terms and conditions are at . ### Support You can ask questions about this issue on GitHub in the .NET GitHub organization. The main repo is located at‚ÄØhttps://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client . The Announcements repo will contain this bulletin as an issue and will include a link to a discussion issue. You can ask questions in the linked discussion issue. ### Disclaimer The information provided in this advisory is provided "as is" without warranty of any kind. Microsoft disclaims all warranties, either express or implied, including the warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. In no event shall Microsoft Corporation or its suppliers be liable for any damages whatsoever including direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, loss of business profits or special damages, even if Microsoft Corporation or its suppliers have been advised of the possibility of such damages. Some states do not allow the exclusion or limitation of liability for consequential or incidental damages so the foregoing limitation may not apply. ### Acknowledgements [Kalle Niemitalo](https://github.com/KalleOlaviNiemitalo) ### External Links [CVE 2023-29337](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2023-29337) ### Revisions V1.0 (June 13, 2023): Advisory published. _Version 1.0_ _Last Updated 2023-06-13_
